Belgium: Gerard van Groesbeeck, Prince-Bishop of Liège, promulgates a new codification of the legal procedures in the principality's courts.
China:
The Longqing Emperor died.
The Longqing Emperor's son the Wanli Emperor became emperor of the Ming dynasty.
Colombia: Foundation of Villa de Leyva by Hernan Suarez de Villalobos
Cyprus: A period began during which twenty eight bloody uprisings occurred.
France: St. Bartholomew's Day massacre of French Protestants.
India: Akbar annexes Gujarat, also shifts the Mughal capital to Fatehpur Sikri where a new township and citadel containing buildings of a unique all-India character—inspired by the architecture of Bengal, Gujarat, Malwa, Kashmir as well as the Timurid world—is born.
Peru: End of the Neo-Inca State in Vilcabamba.
Philippine: Legazpi dies and Guido de Lavezaris succeeds him as Governor-General (1572–1575)
